results.title: Call for order
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Designed to encourage two essentials to an efficient office— tidiness and cleanliness. An office which in the first place is badly designed, and then is littered with superfluous or redundant furniture, articles of clothing, over-flowing waste-paper baskets, stacks of files piled high on desks and tea cups and tea-making equipment, cannot possibly function efficiently, quite apart from being unpleasant to work in. The film offers suggestions aimed at keeping offices clean and tidy, thereby increasing efficiency and saving time, trouble and temper.

results.title: Call an ambulance
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A social studies film outlining the work of Civil Ambulance organisations in an Australian capital city. At all times the specially trained ambulance officers must be ready to answer accident and hospital calls in any part of the city. Ambulance men are seen working in co-operation with a Boy Scout group, in the discovery and rescue of an injured man in an isolated country area.

results.title: Calgary cowboy stampede
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: On the screen in close-up, and often in slow motion - the furious action of the world famous Calgary stampede - a spectacle to pin every viewer to their seat. Sun-fishing broncos, dare-devil cowboys, thundering chuckwagons - they are all here in this film of the annual extravaganza of the west. From the series: The Sport Parade.

results.title: Calder Hall: how a thermal reactor works
results.creator_credit: Ace Films and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Report to Geneva on the progress of Britain’s first nuclear power station, Calder Hall (close to Windscale Atomic Factory, Cumberland), July 1955. Describes the construction of the piles and the reactor. The film covers the various stages from the beginning of work on the preparation of the site in April 1953 to the summer of 1955 when the power station was three-quarters completed.

results.title: Calder Hall
results.brief_description: A report on Calder Hall, Britain’s first atomic power-station, as it was in July 1955. An engineer explains the layout of the two piles and the turbine house which will eventually produce electricity for a wide area.

results.title: Cake decorating with Robyn Hamilton. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: Robyn Hamilton continues with her demonstration on cake decorating techniques. This part is for the more advanced student on the art of lace, frilling, insertion, extension.

results.title: Caged fury (D)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Adventure parade”.
WARNING: CONTAINS VISUALLY DISTURBING IMAGES Man’s capture and training of wild African beasts. The animals are seen in their native surroundings and the continual struggle for survival is depicted in scenes of fighting and killing. Shows the animals being trapped and shipped abroad, and the training methods through which they gradually adapt themselves to a new life.

results.title: Cafe and Boxes
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Nottage and Sydney Dance Company
results.brief_description: Two dance films based on productions conceived and performed by the Sydney Dance Company. “A day in the life of a Darling cafe” is the theme of ‘Cafe’ (62mins. 1995), written and choreographed by dancers Paul Mercurio and Kim Walker. The production resembles a mix between a serious dance work and a satirical cabaret piece and is a behind-the-froth study of cafe society. Music by Brett Cabot and Colin Newham. ‘Boxes’ (60mins. 1985) was conceived by Iva Davies, Bob Kretschmer and Graeme Murphy as a dance work which was first performed by the Sydney Dance Company and the band ‘Icehouse’ at the Sydney Opera House on November 7, 1985.

results.title: Cadet worlds: Portugal, 1974
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Two helmsmen from Tasmania were selected to represent Australia in the 1974 ‘cadet’ Dinghy World Championships. Beginning with the Tasmanian crews mid-winter training at the Sandy Bay Sailing Club in Hobart, the action culminates in the competitions sailed in Portugal.

results.title: Cabbage root fly
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the life cycle of this insect which has become a serious pest in Europe and America, the larvae attacking cruciferous plants such as the cabbage and cauliflower.
